lexUnit.name: break.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: separate or cause to separate into pieces as a result of a blow, shock, or strain.

sentence.text: He carried a stick to aid his ailing right leg which had been broken deliberately by the STB while he was in prison .
Turn to meet Him and he will break your arm .
` Now , boy , " he said , ` take me to the captain or I 'll break your arm ! "
A woman is claiming four policemen broke her arm and two ribs while arresting her for a crime she did n't commit .
It 's alright , Josie , I did n't mean to break your arm , do you know what I mean ?
Fitzsimmons broke Jeffries nose , cut both cheeks to the bone , but Jeffries landed a right to the stomach and a left hook to the jaw and ` Fitz " was counted out .
Spend the day as you wish -- but do n't go within a mile of Radcliffe or I 'll break every bone in his body .
The bird 's darting eye sought his frantically before it glazed ; he thought as it twitched about on the hard dry clods that he might break its neck to bring its death throes to an end .
But when they reached the dock and were waiting for the boat to carry them to the camp , Seth snatched the van 's keys , nearly breaking two of Suzy 's fingers in the struggle .
Lachlan was still snarling and kicking when they uncovered him , and they nearly broke his fingers trying to unfasten them from Farquhar 's neck .
Lie to me , and the gentleman behind you will probably break your fingers one by one , and very possibly the gentlemen wit the club will take a certain delight in knocking out your teeth . "
` Do n't break his fingers , Socrates , just hold him . "
She turns and calls down the corridor for a guy named Malcolm and all the time she 's leaning hard against the door trying to break my foot .
And if I do escape extinction I shall most likely be black and blue from this wood digging into my back -- and I should n't be surprised if you 've broken my wrist . "
Only yesterday in Oxford Frank Baughan called for the youngsters who beat him and broke his wrist to be birched. frank Bishop is n't today 's only victim .
Ralph Baughan was tipped from his wheelchair and set upon by two men who broke his wrist .
They stuffed a sock into her mouth , pushed her inside and kicked her to the floor breaking her ankle and wrist .
Ken , upset , tried to drive his van through the line of Mr Rowse 's patients : he broke the ankle of an elderly man too feeble to jump out of the way .
Jolosa , who broke a rival player 's jaw , was told to model his play on the England striker .
One of my hands and ribs were broken as a result of torture " .
Philip IV 's master torturers , a motley gang of Italians and strange , wild creatures from Wallachia , were expert in breaking the bodies and souls of their prisoners .
